intro: Lithospermum apulum, commonly known as the redroot germander, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and often reddish in color. Lithospermum apulum thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and along roadsides.
